intro: Euphrasia vestita, commonly known as the white-haired eyebright, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Euphrasia vestita is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
